snippet: The statement comes a day after Turkish officials said they had found Russian munitions in a jetliner forced to land in Turkey.
abstract: Russian Foreign Min Sergey V Lavrov says civilian Syrian jetliner impounded by Turkey on suspicion of transporting Russian military cargo illicitly to Syria was carrying only electronic radar gear, and that such equipment falls within bounds of international agreements; statement is most detailed public explanation yet from Russia in its dispute with Turkey over the Moscow-to-Damascus flight.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from Moscow, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Hatay, Turkey, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The statement comes a day after Turkish officials said they had found Russian munitions in a jetliner forced to land in Turkey.

headline.main: Russia Says Syrian Plane Impounded by Turkey Had Radar Gear, Not Arms
headline.print_headline: Russia Says Syrian Plane Impounded by Turkey Had Radar Gear, Not Arms

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
